title: From the Château de Versailles to the Elysée, the unshakable Catherine Pégard
subhead: Against all odds and well beyond her legal term, the former journalist who became adviser to President Nicolas Sarkozy held on as head of the Château de Versailles for 12 years. Forced out of her position in 2024, the skillful and tenacious Catherine Pégard quickly found a seat at the Elysée as culture adviser. Now, rumors suggest she could replace Rachida Dati, currently running for Paris City Hall, if she gives up her ministerial post.

title: French prosecutor seeks homicide charges in far-right activist killing
Trump sees 'maximum' 15 days for Iran to make deal
UK police say ex-prince Andrew 'released under investigation'
subhead: The younger brother of Britain's King Charles was arrested earlier Thursday on suspicion of misconduct during his time as a trade envoy. New revelations appeared to show Andrew sent convicted US sex offender Jeffrey Epstein potentially confidential documents.

title: USA's Alysa Liu wins the gold in Olympic women's figure skating
subhead: The 20-year-old put the US women back on top of the Olympic women's podium in this event for the first time since Sarah Hughes took gold at the 2002 Salt Lake City Games.

title: In Dhaka, Sheikh Hasani's palace has been turned into a museum honoring victims of the July 2024 uprising
subhead: At the center of the vast property in front of the entrance, a monument has been erected in memory of all the victims of the 'Iron Lady's' regime. The museum is set to open to the public in the coming weeks.

title: Tom Fletcher: 'Anyone who says the UN is dead should spend some time with my colleagues in Sudan or DRC'
subhead: The United Nations under-secretary-general for humanitarian affairs defends the role of United Nations agencies in global crises and calls for unhindered access to the Gaza Strip.

France's image deteriorates in the eyes of American investors
Anthropic, the AI start-up that dares to defy Donald Trump
subhead: Dario Amodei, the CEO of the artificial intelligence company, acknowledged disagreements with the White House over the regulation and military use of his technology. This is a rare stance in the US, where the tech industry has generally pledged allegiance to the president.

title: Epstein scandal divides the MAGA world and weakens Trump
subhead: Since the latest release of files on the sexual predator, supporters of the US president have questioned the administration's lack of transparency and confusing communication.

title: France's 13,335 millionaires who pay no income tax
subhead: In 2024, thousands of taxpayers with significant real estate wealth paid no income tax, according to a previously unpublished note from the Finance Ministry. These revelations have reignited the debate over taxing the country's wealthiest.

title: 'The spectacle of European disunity in the face of pressure from both the United States and China is infuriating'
Patrick Artus: 'The unpopular reforms France nevertheless needs to undertake'
Paul Magnette, political scientist: 'If Trump's camp felt superior, why try and divide Europe?'
